pullRequest.body:
In particular we show that being standard smooth is stable under composition and base change.

This contribution was created as part of the AIM workshop "Formalizing algebraic geometry"
in June 2024.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Thanks!
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

This is waiting for a refactor of `algebraize`. Let's just get this merged, and refactor/cleanup once `algebraize` is more powerful.

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by jcommelin.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11364358903/job/31610225285)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11364358903/job/31610225572)
Can we now use `algebraize` here and below?
I would like to, but as far as I can tell `algebraize` has not landed yet, am I missing something (#16217 is still open)?
Oooh, I thought it had already landed! I kicked it on the queue. Please merge master in a few moments.
Voila: `algebraize` is available

`algebraize` is in use now. Unfortunately for `IsStandardSmooth` things don't work as smoothly (...) as I had hoped: Using `algebraize` with `IsStandardSmooth` tagged with `@[algebraize]` causes a metavariable error. I suspect this is because `Algebra.IsStandardSmooth` depends on two additional universe levels. Also for `IsStandardSmoothOfRelativeDimension n` it does likely not work because of the `n` parameter.
@callesonne Do you have an idea whether this would be easy to fix?
Let's return to this at a later point, when `algebraize` has been extended.

```suggestion
@[algebraize]
def IsStandardSmoothOfRelativeDimension (f : R â†’+* S) : Prop :=
```

This causes 
```
failed to synthesize
  CommRing ?S
```
below. I think here it is because `IsStandardSmoothOfRelativeDimension` depends on the parameter `n`.

```suggestion
@[algebraize]
def IsStandardSmooth (f : R â†’+* S) : Prop :=
```

Did you see my above message? This causes in all uses of `algebraize` below:
```
AppBuilder for 'mkAppOptM', result contains metavariables
  Algebra.IsStandardSmooth S T
```
(I think this is due to `IsStandardSmooth` depending on additional universe levels)

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```
Can `algebraize` help here as well?
